title: Beck Hole Thomason Foss Waterfall Walk Route

images.title: David Marsden / Beck Hole
images.caption: Beck Hole. Looking down to the village from close to the railway bridge. The building immediately behind the two cars, and the land beyond, has been the site of a farm since at least the seventeenth century.

images.caption: Birch Hall Inn Beck Hole

images.title: Lis Burke / West Beck gorge
images.caption: West Beck gorge.  Not a gentle Sunday afternoon stroll! The gorge is narrow and rocky in places.

description: This walk visits the Thomason Foss and the Mallyan Spout waterfalls from the little village of Beck Hole in North Yorkshire. The walk starts in the village and follows a footpath east along the Eller Beck to Thomason Foss Wood and the falls. The secluded spot is situated next to the line of the North York Moors railway about half a mile east of the village. The route then retraces its steps before turning south to Carr Wood, West Beck and the impressive Mallyan Spout near Goathland . The 70ft high falls are an impressive sight, especially after rainfall. The route then retraces its steps to Beck Hole though you could return via Goathland and turn it into a longer circular walk if you have time.
